'Istanbul AtatÃ¼rk Airport' () is the main international airport serving
Istanbul, Turkey (followed by Sabiha GÃ¶kÃ§en International Airport) and the
biggest airport in Turkey by total number of passengers. Opened in 1924 and
located in YeÅilkÃ¶y, on the European side of the city, it is west [http://www.ead.eurocontrol.int/publicuser/protect/pu/main.jsp
EAD Basic] of the city centre. In 1980, the airport was renamed AtatÃ¼rk
International Airport in honor of Mustafa Kemal AtatÃ¼rk, the founder and first
president of the Republic of Turkey. It served 45 million passengers in 2012,
making it the 20th busiest airport in the world in terms of total passenger
traffic and the 14th busiest in the world in terms of international passenger
traffic, ranking just below Munich Airport. It was Europe's 6th busiest airport
in 2012, just below Amsterdam and Madrid.

The Turkish Chamber of Civil Engineers lists AtatÃ¼rk International Airport as
one of the fifty civil engineering feats in Turkey, a list of remarkable
engineering projects completed in the first 50 years of the chamber's existence. [http://www.hhportal.com/mimarlik/649149-50-yilda-50-
eser.html The list ]

In the 2013 Air Transport News awards ceremony, Ä°stanbul AtatÃ¼rk Airport was
named Airport of the Year. Also, the airport has been named Europe's
Best Airport in 40-50 million passenger per year category at the 2013 Skytrax
World Airport Awards.
